law.catch_line: No impairment of power of governor to suspend County officers.

text.section:
Sec. 2-11.4. No impairment of power of governor to suspend County officers.
The provisions of shall not be construed as in any wise impairing the constitutional power of the Governor and Senate relating to the suspension and removal of County officers, and the exercise of such constitutional powers by the Governor and Senate shall supersede any actions taken under the provisions of. The provisions of shall not be construed as affecting the powers of the County Commission to remove members of any County Boards or agencies provided by the Code of Miami-Dade County, or as affecting the power of the County Manager to suspend or remove personnel under his administrative jurisdiction not in the classified service of the County.
